verse_content.Sanskrit:
नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप ।
एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ॥ ४० ॥
verse_content.Transliteration:
nānto 'sti mama divyānām
vibhūtīnām parantapa
eșa tūddeśatah prokto
vibhūter vistaro mayā
verse_content.Translation:
O mighty conqueror of enemies, there is no end to My divine manifestations.
What I have spoken to you is but a mere indication of My infinite opulences.
verse_content.Purport:
As stated in the Vedic literature, although the opulences and energies of
the Supreme are understood in various ways, there is no limit to such
opulences; therefore not all the opulences and energies can be explained.
Simply a few examples are being described to Arjuna to pacify his
inquisitiveness.
